Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a designer shows a component's smart tag panel automatically on creation.
Docs.value: to allow a component's smart tag panel to open automatically upon creation; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A component's smart tag panel is set to automatically open when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList.AutoShow%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is `true`.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Adding Smart Tags to a Windows Forms Component

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that enables or disables the component cache.
Docs.value: if the component cache is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The component cache is a performance enhancement that is incompatible with certain designers. You can disable it with this property.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that enables or disables smart tags in the designer.
Docs.value: if smart tags in the designer are enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This option is not exposed on the **Options** item of the **Tools** menu in Visual Studio.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Adding Smart Tags to a Windows Forms Component
